test_name: Verify User Can Successfully Submit the Contact Form
description: This test ensures that a user can fill out and submit the contact form with valid data, and a confirmation message is displayed upon successful submission.
steps: Navigate to the Contact Us page at 'https://atid.store/contact-us/'.
Locate the 'Name' input field using the provided stable selector.
Type a valid name, such as 'John Doe', into the 'Name' input field.
Locate the 'Email' input field using the provided stable selector.
Type a valid email address, such as 'john.doe@example.com', into the 'Email' input field.
Locate the 'Comment or Message' textarea using the provided stable selector.
Type a message, such as 'I have a query about my recent order.', into the 'Comment or Message' textarea.
Locate the 'SEND MESSAGE' button using the provided stable selector.
Verify that a confirmation message, such as 'Your message has been sent successfully!', is displayed on the page.
expected_results: The form is submitted without errors.
A confirmation message is displayed, indicating successful submission.
edge_cases: Submitting the form with empty fields.
Entering an invalid email address format in the 'Email' field.
Typing an excessively long name in the 'Name' field.
Submitting the form without entering a message in the 'Comment or Message' textarea.
Submitting the form multiple times rapidly.
data_requirements: A valid name such as 'John Doe'.
A valid email address such as 'john.doe@example.com'.
A valid message such as 'I have a query about my recent order.'
Confirmation message text for successful submission.
dependencies: The Contact Us page must be accessible.
The form submission backend must be operational.
The confirmation message must be correctly implemented.
api_interactions: Form submission POST request to the backend.
performance_metrics: Form submission response time should be under 2 seconds.
Page load time for the Contact Us page should be under 3 seconds.
accessibility_requirements: All fields should be focusable via keyboard navigation.
The form should have proper aria-labels for screen readers.
The confirmation message should be accessible to screen readers.
